additionalTextInformation.text: On the basis of a record by an Erfurt chronicler from the beginning of the 18th century Overmann identified the donor of the panel as Georg Hirschbach the Elder. [Friedländer, Rosenberg 1979, 97, No. 134]

Numerous 20th century publications describe – sometimes in great detail – a signature at the top edge, for example [Friedländer, Rosenberg 1979, 97, No. 134]. However a technical examination of the panel in 2014 did not provide any indication for the (previous) existence of a signature. [Bornschein 2015, 118-119]

Numerous versions or copies after this composition exist e. g. in St Joseph's Servite Convent, Innsbruck [AT_SJI_NONE-SJI001], in an private collection [PRIVATE_NONE-P455] in the National Gallery in Prague [CZ_NGP_DO4566] and one attributed to Wolfgang Krodel the Elder in Schloss Eggenberg, Graz [AT_UMJ_101].
[cda 2020]

historicEventInformations.remarks: [Dating on the reverse of a postcard in the Archive D. Koepplin, 2001]

pageContext.description: The infant Christ stands on the Virgin's lap and touches St Catherine's hand at the left edge of the painting, while his left hand rests in that of St Barbara at the right edge. In the background two putti hold up a curtain.
pageContext.dimensions:
Dimensions of support: 90 x 62 cm
[Friedländer, Rosenberg 1979, 97, No. 134]

metadata.title: Virgin and Child with Sts Catherine and Barbara

pageContext.provenance:
- first recorded in Erfurt cathedral at the beginning of the 18th century 
- 1801 transferred to the gallery in Aschaffenburg belonging to the sovereign of Erfurt, Elector and Archbishop of Mainz Friedrich Karl Joseph von Erlthal
- 1802 returned to Erfurt
- transferred for safekeeping during the Second World War (when and where is not recorded) 
- 1949 stolen, shortly after offered to the art dealer Levin in West Berlin, he secured it and returned it to the mayor of Erfurt. 
[Bornschein 2015, 121-124]
pageContext.signature:
Artist's insigia at the top edge: winged serpent
[Friedländer, Rosenberg 1979, 97, No. 134]

titles.title: Virgin and Child with Sts Catherine and Barbara
